---
title: 'Serre Duality'
publishedAt: '2025-03-19'
summary: 'I give an overview of the proof of Serre duality.'
---

This is a continuiation of the previous post on the exceptional pullback, where we use it to describe and prove Serre duality following Vakil's *Foundations of Algebraic Geometry*. 

The result that we desire is **functorial Serre duality for vector bundles**, a natural isomorphism of covariant functors from locally free sheaves of finite rank to abelian groups
$$
H^i(X, -) \xrightarrow{\sim} H^{n-i}(X,(-)^{\vee} \otimes \omega_X)^{\vee}
$$
We also want a functorial "cup product" as in Poincare duality, i.e. for any finite rank locally free sheaf $\fanf$ on $X$ we want the following commutative diagram

<Quiver src="https://q.uiver.app/#&macro_url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Frcatullo%2Fstandard-latex-papers%2Fblob%2Fmain%2Fstandard.sty&embed"/>

where $t \colon H^n(X, \omega_X) \to k$ is the *trace map*.
